org.openntf.formula

Interface Function

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AtFunction, AtFunctionGeneric, AtFunctionSimple, Comparators, Negators, Operators, OperatorsAbstract, OperatorsBool, UserDefinedFunction

    public interface Function
    This repesents a "real" formulaexpression. A real formulaexpression is a formula, that does NOT control the program flow (like @if, @for or @transform". Formulas that controls program flow must be implemented as own AST-node).
    Author:
    Roland Praml, Foconis AG

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkParamCount(int i)
      Checks if the function accpets the amount of parameters
      ValueHolder evaluate(FormulaContext ctx, ValueHolder[] params)
      Evaluates the formula.
      String getImage()
      returns the Image of the AtFunction (with at-sign)

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        ValueHolder evaluate(FormulaContext ctx,
                     ValueHolder[] params)
              throws FormulaReturnException
        Evaluates the formula.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context that contains "database" and so on
        params - the parameters as ValueHolder
        Returns:
        a ValueHolder
        Throws:
        FormulaReturnException - if a @return Statement was executed

      • getImage

        String getImage()
        returns the Image of the AtFunction (with at-sign)
        Returns:
        a String

      • checkParamCount

        boolean checkParamCount(int i)
        Checks if the function accpets the amount of parameters
        Parameters:
        i - amount of params specified in formula string
        Returns:
        true if parameter-count matches to this function.
